intro: Hygrophila brevituba, commonly known as the short-tubed hygrophila, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale green to white in color. It thrives in moist environments, such as wetlands and along the edges of ponds. Hygrophila brevituba is often used in aquatic gardening and as a decorative plant in water features.
